creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: three vertical ornamental studies, one rectangular, and two more triangular; sinuous vines with thick leaves emerge vertically from ornate ewers at the bottom, each with a slightly different variation
inscription:
Signature, Inscription, Mark, Stamp

-- inscribed in plate at bottom: 147
-- in graphite on verso: 17731 | APG 6134 | #2057 | 8MLWZ | B.88
markings: blue stamp on verso, lower left: Collection d\'Arenberg (Lugt 567)
provenance: Ducs d'Arenberg; [C. & J. Goodfriend, New York, until October 17, 1983; sold to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: initialed in plate above artist\'s pinecone emblem, lower right: [HD]
title: Ornament with Vase; Two Designs for Sheaths
